sen.j: 岡田国神社（おかだくにじんじゃ）は、京都府木津川市（旧相楽郡木津町）にある神社である。
sen.e: Okadakuni-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture (formerly Kizu-cho, Soraku County).
Okadakuni-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture (formerly Kizu-cho, Soraku County).
Okadakuni-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture (formerly Kizu-cho, Soraku-gun County).

sen.j: 式内社で、旧社格は郷社。
sen.e: It is listed in the Engishiki Jinmyocho (register of shrines and deities in the book of regulations of the Engi era), and was ranked as a fusha (prefectural shrine) under the old shrine classification system.

It is listed in the Engishiki Jinmyocho (register of shrines and deities in the book of regulations of the Engi era), and was ranked as a fusha (prefectural shrine) under the old shrine classification system.
The shrine is Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers)) and was ranked as a gosha (village shrine) under the old shrine classification system.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.e: Enshrined Deities
Enshrined Deities
Enshrined Deities

sen.j: 生国魂命と菅原道真を主祭神とし、八幡神（仲哀天皇・神功皇后・応神天皇）を配祀する。
sen.e: The main deities are Ikukunitama no mikoto and SUGAWARA no Michizane which are enshrined with the associated deities Hachiman-shin (Emperor Chusui, Empress Jingu and Emperor Ojin).
The main deities are Ikukunitama no mikoto and SUGAWARA no Michizane which are enshrined with the associated deities Hachiman-shin (Emperor Chusui, Empress Jingu and Emperor Ojin).
The main deities are Ikukunitama no mikoto and SUGAWARA no Michizane which are enshrined with the associated deities Hachimanshin (God of War) (Emperor Chusui, Empress Jingu and Emperor Ojin).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 岡田国神社の元々の祭神は生国魂命である。
sen.e: Ikukunitama no mikoto was enshrined in Okadakuni-jinja Shrine from its foundation.

sen.j: 菅原道真は平安時代より祀られるようになったもので、当社は江戸時代までは天神宮・木津駅惣社天神社と称していた。
sen.e: SUGAWARA no Michizane had been enshrined since the Heian period and this shrine was named Tenman-gu Shrine/Kizu-eki Soja Tenjinsha Shrine until the Edo period.
SUGAWARA no Michizane had been enshrined since the Heian period and this shrine was named Tenman-gu Shrine/Kizu-eki Soja Tenjinsha Shrine until the Edo period.
SUGAWARA no Michizane had been enshrined since the Heian period and this shrine was named Tenman-gu Shrine/Kizu-eki Soja Tenjinsha Shrine until the Edo period.
History
History
History

sen.j: 社伝では、斉明天皇5年（659年）9月、生国魂尊を祀ったのに始まると伝えられる。
sen.e: According to shrine legend, Okadakuni-jinja Shrine began with the enshrining of Ikukunitama no mikoto in 9th month of the year 659.
According to shrine legend, Okadakuni-jinja Shrine began with the enshrining of Ikukunitama no mikoto in 9th month of the year 659.
According to shrine legend, Okadakuni-jinja Shrine began with the enshrining of Ikukunitama no mikoto in September, 659.

sen.j: 国史の初見は、『日本三代実録』貞観 (日本)元年（859年）年正月27日条の当社に従五位上の神階を授けるという記述である。
sen.e: The first written reference to the shrine in the provincial history appears in the entry for the 27th day of the 1st month of the year 859 in "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (The True History of Three Reigns of Japan) that states that the shrine was granted the rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

The first written reference to the shrine in the provincial history appears in the entry for the 27th day of the 1st month of the year 859 in "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (The True History of Three Reigns of Japan) that states that the shrine was granted the rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

The first written reference to the shrine appears in the "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (sixth of the six classical Japanese history texts) entry for the 27th day of the 1st month of the year 859 (March 9, 859) when it was granted the rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳では大社に列している。
sen.e: It is classified as a taisha in the Engishiki Jinmyocho.
It is classified as a taisha in the Engishiki Jinmyocho.
It is classified as a taisha (grand shrine) in Engishiki Jinmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 平安時代、天神信仰が高まり、当社に菅原道真（天神）が合祀され、以降、天神宮と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: Belief in Tenjin increased during the Heian period and SUGAWARA no Michizane (Tenjin) was enshrined alongside the existing deities, leading the shrine to become named Tenjin-gu Shrine.
Belief in Tenjin increased during the Heian period and SUGAWARA no Michizane (Tenjin) was enshrined alongside the existing deities, leading the shrine to become named Tenjin-gu Shrine.

Belief in Tenjin (heavenly deities) increased during the Heian period and SUGAWARA no Michizane (Tenjin) was enshrined alongside the existing deities, leading the shrine to become named Tenjin-gu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 天慶元年（938年）11月、相殿の八幡宮が創建された。
sen.e: The Hachiman-gu aidono (building in which subordinate deities are enshrined) was founded in the 11th month of the year 938.
The Hachiman-gu aidono (building in which subordinate deities are enshrined) was founded in the 11th month of the year 938.
The Hachiman-gu was founded as Aidono (building in which subordinate deities are enshrined) in November, 938.

sen.j: 明治6年（1873年）5月に郷社に列格した。
sen.e: It was ranked as a gosha (village shrine) in the May 1873.
It was ranked as a gosha (village shrine) in the May 1873.
It was ranked as a gosha (village shrine) in the May 1873.

sen.j: 明治11年（1878年）3月、当社が式内・岡田国神社であると国により確定され、岡田国神社に改称した。
sen.e: In March 1878, the shrine was nationally determined to be the Okadakuni-jinja Shrine listed in the Engishiki Jinmyocho and renamed "Okadakuni-jinja Shrine".
In March 1878, the shrine was nationally determined to be the Okadakuni-jinja Shrine listed in the Engishiki Jinmyocho and renamed "Okadakuni-jinja Shrine".
In March 1878, the shrine was nationally determined to be the Okadakuni-jinja Shrine listed in the Engishiki Jinmyocho and renamed Okadakuni-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: なお、岡田国神社については勝手神社（木津川市加茂町大野）境内末社の春日神社も論社となっている。
sen.e: Kasuga-jinja Shrine, a subsidiary shrine within the precinct of Katte-jinja Shrine (Ono, Kamo Cho, Kizugawa City), is also theorized to be the Okadakuni-jinja Shrine listed in the Engishiki Jinmyocho.

Kasuga-jinja Shrine, a subsidiary shrine within the precinct of Katte-jinja Shrine (Ono, Kamo Cho, Kizugawa City), is also theorized to be the Okadakuni-jinja Shrine listed in the Engishiki Jinmyocho.

Kasuga-jinja Shrine, a subsidiary shrine within the precinct of Katte-jinja Shrine (Ono, Kamo-cho, Kizugawa City), is also listed as ronja (shrines considered to be descendants of a shikinai-sha) of Okadakuni-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.e: Precinct
Precinct
Precinct

sen.j: 昭和58年、4万坪の境内地の一部が日本住宅公団に買却され、その代金によって新社殿が建立された。
sen.e: In 1983, part of the approximately 132,400m² precinct was purchased by the Japan Housing Corporation and the money was used to construct a new shrine building.
In 1983, part of the approximately 132,400m² precinct was purchased by the Japan Housing Corporation and the money was used to construct a new shrine building.
In 1983, part of the approximately 132,400m² precinct was purchased by the Japan Housing Corporation and the money was used to construct a new shrine building.

sen.j: 旧社殿一式もそのまま残されており、昭和63年に京都府登録文化財となった。
sen.e: The former shrine building remains in its entirety and was designated a cultural property registered by Kyoto Prefecture in 1988.
The former shrine building remains in its entirety and was designated a cultural property registered by Kyoto Prefecture in 1988.
The former shrine building remains in its entirety and was designated a cultural property registered by Kyoto Prefecture in 1988.
